Reviews.Title: “Location, price, quality - Beldes has it all!”
Reviews.Author: Brian O
Reviews.Content: 8 blocks from the Vatican and one block from the Subway (perfect) - I was very impressed with this Hotel. We showed up very late (11pm) and the hotel was 24 hours, which was nice. We were escorted to our room and shown how the keys work and wished a good evening. The gentleman spoke english well and we found everyone else there did also (which was good, because our Italian was very poor). The FREE included breakfast was nice. A good selection of a mix between continental and full breakfast. They also had proper coffee. Security was very good at this hotel, almost over the top, but not a bad problem to have right? The room was honestly beautiful that we stayed in. Beldes has two buildings and we stayed at the second building. The room was slightly small by USA standards, but you have to recognize where you are. The room is actually large for Rome. It has everything and the bathroom was great with a wonderful shower. The room and the whole hotel for that matter was very clean with daily maid service. It was also very quiet at night. We didn't stay in the main hotel but where we were had a great view of a really beautiful church and was quiet. I'd ask to stay in the second building I suppose if your worried about noise. I did notice however that the main hotel rooms looked just like our room when we would walk to breakfast. Again however, Location and price! Cheap and close to what you need. There were a few restaurants in the area but they all seemed pretty much the same with the same menu, so search around for a good place to eat, Italy has many of those.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel within walking distance of everything”
Reviews.Author: Fornuftig
Reviews.Content: We visited start april and stayed for 4 nights. A nice hotel with friendly staff, a nice roof garden and good breakfast. The room was very nice, and the building is an old charming building located in a nice quiet neighborhood. The area is not crowded with tourits and the shops and restaurents are not tourist traps but genuine buisnesses. Only downside is that the rooms are a bit loudy.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: moby_ugh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Beldes roughly 2 years previous and loved this 'boutique' hotel. I would recommend it to people who were visiting Rome. So when I happened to be revisiting Rome (I must have thrown my coins in Trevi fountain), there was only one place I wanted to stay -Beldes. Well, what a difference a couple of years makes. Perhaps absence makes the heart grow fonder.....but I have to say I was very disappointed. The first time I stayed the room was spacious, the bathroom was AMAZING and impeccably clean, breakfast was fabulous with a large selection of cakes, meats, tarts, fruit and barista worthy coffee on offer. This time the the room was pokey, the bathroom was laughable and breakfast was average. Our room was on the top floor. 6b if I remember rightly. Instead of the solid silver room numbers that adorn each room, our room had '6b' scrawled in pen on piece of curling masking tape. Not a good first impression. The room has been painted in dark chocolate brown paint, which has a nice effect apart from the fact it hasn't been repainted in years and it's chipped and cracked and really makes you feel as though you are staying in a dormitory. The bathroom is a flimsy add on. Meaning the bathroom has obviously been added on but done on a super tight budget, or maybe a DIY knock up job. So apart from being TINY, it's not very well ventilated. Just look at the walls in the bathroom...mouldy (shudder)! Also the bathroom fixtures are pretty second rate. I flushed the toilet and the whole flush plate mounted on the wall fell off with an almighty crash. My final gripe would have to be in regards to service. Having an early morning flight we booked an early morning taxi to the airport (4:15am). To me that means at 415am the hotel will arrange a taxi and it will be waiting downstairs at 415am. To the Beldes this means wait till the guests have checked out and are waiting on the curb (at 415am) and THEN call for a taxi which may or may not turn up for another 30 minutes. Perhaps we were just unlucky and got the short straw on this stay. Perhaps management need a lesson in maintenance and service. Perhaps there has been a change in management since I visited last. Unfortunately I won't be returning to find out!

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough for the price.”
Reviews.Author: elifsy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very close to a metro station and walk distance from vatican. Room was nice but it was on -1st floor and very close (like couple steps) to the breakfast room. So you can have the every single kind of smell+all the rumour of the breakfast in your bed! Stuff was not very kind, we carried our three pieces of baggage to the room and as a woman i carried it out by myself after check-out! Breakfast was poor, and you have to wait 15 minutes for your tea/coffee to arrive and once again the stuff was rude. We asked for a double bed on reservation and they have given us a "poorly attached twin bed" which gets seperated in any kind of movement! Since we spent a part of our honeymoon in this hotel, it was pretty disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for young couples”
Reviews.Author: LadBroke8
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for about 4 days in Nov 2011 with my husband. It was our first time in Rome so we were excited to stay in a boutique hotel in the city. Pros: 1) Hotel is a 7min walk to Lepanto Metro station. 2) Buffet breakfast is good enough to get you going for the day, consisting of a selection of breads, cereals, cold cuts and cheese. 3) Hotel and room was clean and looked freshly refurbished...(note below tiny overlooked details). 4) Staff were very friendly and accommodating. Always ready to help out. Cons: 1) Although the hotel did look remodeled, you could still hear people through the rather thin walls, ie. walking on the hardwood floor, flushing their toilet or draining their tub next door, and one of our walls had a tiny hole, as if an electrical outlet was supposed to be there but was placed elsewhere. These were minor details that we had lived with, but it would be great if these were addressed in the long run. 2) Be prepared to stay in a room that doesn't look exactly as advertised, as each room is decorated differently but basic amenities remain the same such as en suite bath/shower, etc. For the price, I would still recommend this to those wishing to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location...”
Reviews.Author: Susied60
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend in Jan. Lovely hotel just round the corner from Lepanto tube station from where you can reach any of the major attractions that Rome has to offer quickly and cheaply. Subway is easy to navigate as there are only two lines A and B...you cant go wrong !! We got the Terravision bus from the airport (4 euro) to the Termini where we got the tube to Lepanto (1 euro) and walked the 250 metres to the hotel..much better than paying exhorbitant taxi fares !! Staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful. All said we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would recommend to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Near to Metro station. The Vatican is just a 10 minute walk away. Extremely helpful and friendly desk staff. The room was very clean and sheets and towels were changed on a daily basis. Breakfast was quite nice. There is no leisure area to sit and chat, just a reception desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Jessica L
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel.. it was very clean and updated. The breakfast was WONDERFUL! The staff was so friendly and went out of their way to help us. We stayed in the hotel annex just one block away but still loved our stay here. It was very closed to the Locando subway stop which made it very easy for us to get around the city. Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Beldes the best!”
Reviews.Author: valentinomatisse
Reviews.Content: Close to the Vatican, a very good situation and good hotel. Next time we need a hotel in Rome, it will be the beldes again

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: UandB
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel from the internet as it looked clean and value for money. And yes it was clean. It is convenient for the Vatican, but not much else, with very few restaurants in the area. We were informed, on arrival, that we had a lovely room, which turned out to be small and right next to the reception area and rather noisy. We got changed to a better room in the basement, but the downside was there was little natural light as there was a tree right outside the window, however, this was not a problem as we were out during the day. Vending machines were all that was available with no glasses to drink from. The bathrooms in both rooms had almost nowhere to put anything and the lighting was very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls, made to walk to some dodgy apartment building”
Reviews.Author: Londres_Dave
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been put together with the intention of 'on the cheap'. We arrived to a pokey reception area and were soon to realise that this was the socialising area for the hotel - or lack there of it. No couches to relax and chat was the first downer. We were then told as we had 'booked early' - that we had special rooms. Thinking this was good, we were led outside of the hotel for 1 block to some dodgy apartment building (given, it was quaint) where a large apartment has been converted in hotel rooms. Obviously at this point we were disappointed we were not in the actual hotel we had booked, we soon noted that the corridor was pokey, walls were very thin and the decor cheaply done. The shower leaked water everywhere in the bathroom and the room was very small. Breakfast was decent, however the breakfast room was boiling. Overall the stay isn't as expected and not value for money. A decent location though.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT !”
Reviews.Author: NadiaSoraiaSantos
Reviews.Content: It's a lovely hotel, beautiful and in a very good location, near Vaticano! The rooms with bathroom are very good, great decoration and very comfortable, the people are very nice and friendly (they helped us to contact an taxi and take care of our bags, even after we made the check out and this way we could enjoy more the last day in the city). The hotel have a terrace in the last floor that can be use by the guests! Breakfast is very good with a lot of options and the room is great with an indoor garden! Very clean and calm! I love this hotel! If I get back to Rome i will stay at Beldes, surely! No doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff”
Reviews.Author: opalka90
Reviews.Content: Staff are really helpful, especially the owner of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Svetlana A
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very modern , really nice decor , the rooms were cleaned daily . Staff were so friendly and helpful. Nearby there are fantastic restaurant Ninfeo . Ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!! Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Natsalvo26
Reviews.Content: This was the BEST hotel I had stayed in,during my 6 week stay in Italy. First initial greeting was warm and welcoming,was given maps and explanations where everything was etc.. I was then escorted to my room in the dependance,which is a 2 minute walk from the hotel..it was stunning, in our own apartment block,much preferred it to actually staying in the hotel itself. The room was spotless and stunning,french style black and white theme,and the bathroom was beautiful,but what I really loved was the large rain shower shower head !! So relaxing,good water pressure! The other fantastic point was free wi-fi ! Just asked them for a code and I was online 24/7 for up to 7 days..that was really convenient and a nice touch compared to paying extravagant internet prices. Breakfast was lovely, there were definitely FRESH danish pastries every morning,selection of cheese's,ham's,tea cakes,breads,cereal's,boiled eggs,fresh juices and made to order coffee. Tip..get in early for breakfast,the breakfast room fills up around 8,30-9am. The rooms were cleaned daily to exceptional standard, possibly the cleanest I've come across,even the shower's were cleaned daily,and fresh fluffy towels.,mini bar was always stocked. Staff were so friendly and helpful. Nearby there are quite a few choices of restaurants,bar's and gelateria's, and 5 minute walk away you will find all the main leading shops,a large supermarket and it's also the way leading to the Vatican which was only 10 mins away. I saw all the sight's on foot,so it was a great location. Upon departure, I asked for a late checkout and was told 12pm,which meant I didn't have to rush, I then left all the luggage in storage at reception and then a lovely limousine transfer was booked for me for only €55 to the airport (a taxi can cost up to €60 ) fantastic service. I can't wait to return again in January,even my partner loved the style of room and spoke about it for days! I would love to stay in the dependance again. I got a chance to view a few of their rooms,and they were all as in the pictures on the website,21 different rooms and different styles. The owners are doing a fantastic job,congratulations!

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern unique place but needs a few tweaks (great potential)!”
Reviews.Author: Marie N
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and its got potential to be a good hotel. The room was very modern, really nice funky decor - but not traditional italian if thats what you are looking for! Its about a 15 minute walk to Vatican City and the local tube station is just round the corner so really easy to get around. Our room was clean and comfortable. We have only rated it average as we feel there were lots of things that should and could be done to make it better. We were under the impression there was a bar in the hotel - which would be perfect to go with the roof terrace (very nice), when we asked at reception he explained the "bar" was a vending machine on the basement floor stocked with cans of beer! Also there was a mini bar in the room and a price list given in the hotel room booklet, but nothing in the mini bar - we initially thought it had just not been stocked for our arrival, but again we asked at reception and were told to use the vending machines on the basement floor for snacks and water. Another funny with the room is that although there was 2 wardrobes, there was no drawers, so you could only really unpack hanging clothes?! The roof terrace was lovely and empty, but at the top floor before you go outside, its all a bit unfinished... think some kind of building work was going on... at first I wasn't actually sure if we were allowed up there as it looked so unfinished (perhaps they are building a real bar!! That would be good!). Other than that breakfast was good and 24 hour reception.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: NHBLondon
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were escorted out of the building to a "deluxe" apartment in another building! This room was clean but nothing like the advertised hotel experience. Breakfast the next day was below average - machine coffee and stale bread. The staff were disinterested and were unable to direct us to a cab or metro the following day. The hotel is not very convenient for the sites of Rome. It's only selling point is the price - remember you get what you pay for and in this case not much!

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely”
Reviews.Author: ladylianne_25
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights here and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We were in a group of 4 and both rooms we had were comfortable, clean and unique. The staff were very friendly and the overall feel of the hotel is very homely. Great location and great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AnneboasC
Reviews.Content: We really loved the place though the only negative thing was that we were woken up very early by our next doors neighbours....paper thin walls but we loved the design and the location. Very friendly staff and breakfast was very correct. Lovely roofop terrace. The concierge recommended the restaurant around the corner (I forgot the name) but it wasn't great and too expensive...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: MATEOCF
Reviews.Content: We have spend one night in Beldes together with my girlfriend. Hotel is nicely designed and have a good location. Hotel staff was very friendly. The only thing we have to complain were the thin walls. We could have hear people from next room moving out in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: rhewitt307
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the beautiful Beldes at the end of June set for a typical sightseeing trip to Rome. The Beldes is just a short metro trip away from the termini and very easy to find from the metro stop, Lapento. We were greeted by a friendly gentleman on reception who had maps at the ready to talk us through where we were in relation to all the sights which was extrmeely helpful and we soon realised we were a 30-40 minute walk from the furthest away sight- the Colesseum. Everything else (pantheon, spanish steps, trevi etc) were no more than 15 minutes walk, in fact we never used a taxi or metro for the remainder of our trip. We were central yet not stuck right in the middle of the hustle and bustle of huge amounts of tourists, Round the corner from thee best pizza takeaway place which is constantly queing with locals and sells the most luchious slices of the proper roman pizza most of us go looking for in Rome. For nightlife you're just a 10 minute walk from the palace near the river which has some lovely little bars to stop and have a glass of wine, then when you cross the river you're in Piazza Navona territory which has tens of restaurants. The rooms are great and the bathrooms lovely and clean. The shower is fantastic which is always a must for me in hotels. You're room is cleaned daily to an excellent standard with fresh towels left. The hotel has a fantastic roof terrace which we used for a couple of hours when we reached day 3 and needed just a few hours rest from the hustle and bustle that Rome is. Its stunning up there and a real selling point for this hotel. You wouldn't get that in a huge hotel packed with tourists in the very very centre of Rome. We felt very much close to everything we needed yet tucked away in a quiet, local spot. Use this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: vincenty
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 4 days in July and we were very happy with our choice,staff very helpful and pleasant, really nice breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful staff but not a good area, far from sights and thin walls”
Reviews.Author: JoslinAnn
Reviews.Content: While the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, there are better hotels for the real roma experience. The area looked shady with grafitti, they have an annex part and its not an annex. Its in a whole separate building on the 4th level two blocks away...really weird and creepy! The walls are also very thin, you can hear everything...no closet for luggage. The breakfast is a frozen baked goods that are warmed up in the morning..wow fresh! we would def not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Valter1984
Reviews.Content: Great great hotel! Very well located. Close to a metro station, 15 minutes walk to the Vatican, the 'Piazza del Popolo' or Castelo Sant'Angelo! The rooms were nicely furnished and with a good size. Our room was cleaned every day with carefull and the only problem i've found was a little bit of humidity next to the window behind the curtains. The halls of the hotel are very nice and have a lovely smell, nice paintings on the walls too. The staff is very nice and polite and the managers are very attentive! The breakfast is good but not very diverse and the coffee/milk machine isn't on the same room where you eat... You just have to order it to the staff and they'll bring you what you want in 1 ou 2 minutes. The place where you have breakfast is nice but the roof garden is amazing... Stayed there some minutes one night with only some candle light and it was magical! We've found this hotel for a reasonable price and so we've booked it. Rome's a very expensive city but for the price the Beldes Hotel have you can say it's a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “perfecto”
Reviews.Author: damirubyjones
Reviews.Content: well where can i start-arriving at beldes it looked very smart from the outside and on entry it was just as lovely,it was a very trendy boutique hotel. The staff at the hotel were fantastic providing us with all information about the area and where to go for first visits and places to eat and drink, we were showed to our room which was the annex situated a stones throw from main hotel, The room was very very very clean ,nicely decorated with everything you can possibly need,i was just beautiful and very romantic, now the breakfast was amazing all you need to set u up for a day around the city- from pastries gorgeous cakes, meats cheeses all the fruit you can eat, and the cappichino s were great,i was always looking forward to breakfast, to sum up i had an amazing stay,we loved it and for sure all the staff and the owners of beldes made our holiday very special-fantastic little gem ,thank you to all the team. danielle

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel in a quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: clevelandtravelgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of April, it is very close to the Metro and near Vatican City. It is far enough away from the touristy areas but the Metro makes it easy to get anywhere you need or you can walk. We had two rooms that were like the picture gallery, trendy and modern. One of the rooms was "deluxe" and had a larger bathroom and a couple of english channels. The "regular" rooms do not have those items. One of the rooms needed to be repainted as the walls were all marked up. The showers are very small and they do not provide conditioner in the tolietry selections. Breakfast was a good selection. The staff is friendly (except for one day person who was unhelpful) although they really didn't seem to know where the internet cafes in the area were, we couldn't have been the first people to ask. The only downside to the hotel is that the stariway is open and the hallways are stairs are not carpeted which makes it very noisey at night, you can hear everyone come in, so be warned if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service!!”
Reviews.Author: leediax
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the owner of the hotel have lied to me... Before we've arrived I had a very friendly chat with the owner and I have hope that all was settle. They've offered me a suite room for an extra 10 euros a night,witch I gree to pay of course. At the reception we've found out that the suite room doesn't exist and they charge me any way 10 euros extra for a night. Please be cerful what you are paing for.... Enjoy your stay in Rome,its amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Just decent”
Reviews.Author: Pupinek
Reviews.Content: location: 15 min walk to Vatican City, 5 min walk to the metro station staff: not very friendly or helpful hotel: trendy, clean, nicely decorated rooms: enough space, big bed, walls need to be repainted, time TV and NO English channel (Italian TV is nothing but people screaming, shouting, crying on their knees = totally crazy) breakfast: not very extincting, slow service Internet: slow

Reviews.Title: “beldes rome”
Reviews.Author: piotrkoczara
Reviews.Content: The staff were great, helpful and polite. The room was very clean and spacious. (I was expecting it to be small from other peoples reviews but it wasn't). We had a double bed with tv and another section with a sofa and another tv. Nicely decorated with comfy bed and nice furniture.You can get most of the TV programmes in there original language too which is great. (Read the sky manual in the room) It was a great location, a brisk 7 min walk to Vatican and 20 min (10 euro taxi) over the river to Campo dei Fiori.Also Metro station just round the corner. The rooms aren't very sound proofed so you can hear other doors etc although this wasn't a problem at night as the hotel is quiet. Breakfast service was a bit slow as everyone arrived at same time.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, not very touristy.”
Reviews.Author: mustaqtvpm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a very quiet area of rome. safe too. rooms are typical old roman style and well maintained. service was good and staff were very helpful. its in a quiet area , so if u need a good supper, might have to satisfy with whats available around. not many choices. also had to travel a bit for sight seeing as there is not many places near this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would I recommend this hotel? Probably not.”
Reviews.Author: traceyb_856
Reviews.Content: On arrival our initial impressions were very good, the interior in the main entrance was really nice and it appeared to reflect the boutique pictures on the website…………this was until we saw our room! We were given keys to 9A on the 1st floor; we were unable to locate the room until the girl on reception led us to a door with ‘Privado’ above it (no room number). The room was tiny. It was as if they had converted a store room into an additional room. A double bed was pushed up against a window, so you were unable to walk round one side. The room needed a good lick of paint as the walls were really scuffed. The bathroom was also small; no bath just a shower unit. The room though was clean. The breakfast was OK, a bit disappointing if I’m honest. The service was slow and the coffee was very weak. The hotel it’s self was located in a good area, not far from the Vatican and very close to a Metro station if needed. Fortunately we still had a fantastic trip and enjoyed our short stay in Rome. We will be back, but probably not to the Beldes.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful city and this hotel was 1st class”
Reviews.Author: lorharvey
Reviews.Content: The staff were warm and friendly, the location was perfect for all the sights... couldn't fault it at all...Definatley recommend Beldes to anyone..

Reviews.Title: “Bitter Sweet”
Reviews.Author: confusedcarrot
Reviews.Content: My new husband and i visited this hotel on the end of our honeymoon, which we informed the hotel. We arrived with a friendly ease reception and given a room nicely decorated, but dark and small, with nothing overly special about it. No Tea and Coffee and i am usually not that bothered but as there was no where to get a cup of tea. The staff are lovely and the cleanliness is to a high standard. The breakfast is good and well varied and there is a roof top terrace you can enjoy your own drink and food. Do not order a drink as we paid 15 Euro for a small wine and a can of beer! The location isn't great, but its only a 10 min walk to the vatican. I dont think this hotel is good value, we paid about £450 for a 3 night stay in a room that wasn't worth it, overall i was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “a little gem”
Reviews.Author: carl6789
Reviews.Content: hi needed a stopover with my partner , and found this hotel to be very clean and friendly , its is 4min walk to Lepanto metro , added avantage with this hotel is the roof terrace . 15 min walk to vatican , where you can pick up the open bus tours which take about an hour , when you walking is done the Hotel beldes is an oasis , thankyou for a nice stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a tourist”
Reviews.Author: Draytondave
Reviews.Content: We were greeted well and shown great hospitality. John one of the owners went out of his way to make us feel comfortable during our stay. A great location for sight seeing with the metro and bus services just around the corner. Very clean, and a very good breakfast spread. I would certainly go here again. The bar lounge was only open till 8:00 pm and after a long day of sight seeing would have liked to use it and the roof top terrace more.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: just_me_jully07
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel located in a quite good area, very close to the Lepanto metro station. The personnel was very helpful. The rooms are quite small but well equipped. (not looking like in the hotel presentation....but stil ok...)Breakfast was ok, although the coffee in the morning was instant coffee. If your looking for the Italian espresso, just try it on a terrace. We were staying in Rome just for four days, but we managed to visit quite a lot due to the advance booking of the tickets – i.e. Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in Vatican area”
Reviews.Author: Victoria-Vica
Reviews.Content: Very stylish boutique hotel with great location in central Rome. Friendly staff,excellent service and reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “exellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: MARNIX6
Reviews.Content: great hotel for very good price.good location ,very nice rooms ,staff exellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beldes guest house - a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: 187069Liz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Beldes Guest house last month and after reading some of the reviews on here I was a little unsure of what to expect but I can honestly say it was a truely lovely, clean and inviting hotel. The location was good, off the beaten track so to speak ( which was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of the touristy areas!).. but only a 10 minute walk from the Vatican city and there is a metro station only a stones throw away. As soon as we arrived we were helped with our luggage and upgraded to a room with a four poster bed without extra charge. The staff were very friendly and happy to assist with any enquiry. The rooms were clean and the decor of the whole hotel was fab, like that of a boutique hotel. Breakfast was plentiful and served in a lovely room again with fab decor. The roof terrace was a haven of peace and tranquility after a days sightseeing. Don't be put off by some of the negative comments on here as this hotel is deffinitely worth a stay. I have in fact already recommended it to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst hotel ever... but very close.”
Reviews.Author: MMMGirkin
Reviews.Content: I was incredibly disappointed with this hotel. Don't be fooled by a few throw pillows in the pictures. We stayed in the annex. It looked like the pictures but was obviously taken a looong time ago. The white walls were covered in black scuff marks. The blankets were stained. The bed was two singles pushed together which i would expect in a cheaper hotel, but not in something of this price. More than that the two singles they had put side by side were a different height, so you'd roll off! One was fairly soft, but the other was like a bag of rocks. All the details were missing, like buttons off the bedheads and tops off the taps in the bathroom. Also the tiny safe wasn't bolted to anything so what was the point? Breakfast and proximity to the Vatican was good, however the location was a little seedy at night and restaurants were limited. The staff were not pleasant and rather dodgy, wanting you to pay before you'd seen the room. We stayed here twice as we had to return to Rome a second time before departing Italy. I would have found something else but unfortunately didn't have the time. On this second visit they put us in a totally different hotel. It was twice as far as the original annex and the decor was in a very shabby traditional style, nothing like the pictures. I had the feeling we were the only ones on the floor, there were big cameras in the hallways and it was all very creepy. I felt this place was a total rip off, way overpriced for the poor standard of rooms, location and service. Very very dodgy and an inaccurate website. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be enticed by the website. Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: CM1977London
Reviews.Content: Really disappointing. Don't bother. Small and dingy. The fancy pictures of rooms and roof terrace are absolutely false advertising. Really noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Geat Hotel, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: DarinDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from Rome after a four night stay at the Hotel Beldes H.R. What can I tell you? Well as a former Hotel Manager I am a bit picky about the properties that I stay in. In other words I know too much. I got the Hotel name from Tripadvisor and looked at all the reviews. I was pleasantly surprised by this property. It is spotlessly clean , with very friendly staff and a good quality breakfast. The room both my partner and I had was very adequate for what we needed and very clean. The bathroom is a bit on the small side but serves its purpose. This property is located in an area that is busy during the day and very quite in the evening. It is a bit off the tourist beaten track , which believe me is not a bad thing. It is located on the west of the Tiber river and is close to the Vatican City, about two metro stops away . There are some lovely Restaurants in the area and it wont cost the earth to eat out. The Hotel Beldes is newish and full of Modern art on the walls of the corridors leading to the bedrooms. Even though this property is newish it has some old world type furniture in the bedrooms and to me is a hidden gem. It is a boutique style hotel and it makes the property a little bit special, better than a large impersonal hotel. The breakfast is lovely . There is the usual continental fair of sliced meats and cheeses, juices , cakes and fresh coffee. One word of warning is get to the breakfast room early . Its small and located on the 2nd floor . It does get busy , so if you don't want other tourists eating everything like a plague of locusts get there, Monday to Friday 8am ish. Weekends I'm not sure. The Reception staff are very knowledgeable and have tourist maps to hand and can recommend local restaurants to you . Great Value. There is a Metro station " Lepanto" to the rear of the hotel and you are between one and three stops away to the east of the Tiber to all the tourist attractions , Spanish steps , Trevi Fountains etc. Overall couldn't recommend this hotel enough , if you want a very good base at an easy pace with the city on your step. Another tip is buy the Roma Pass if you are going to spend three days in Rome €25 and it covers all your metro , bus and tram price and get you into two major tourist attractions. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price and good location”
Reviews.Author: DanaiSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Beldes for a weekend. The location is good (10 min walk from the Vatican and St Peter, around the corner from Metro station) and in a quiet street. Not very touristic though, so first night that we arrived late we did not manage to find sth close to go for dinner. The hotel had a boutique feel to it. However our room had some unfinished details (mainly plaster and paint work on the walls). Most frustrating was that our room was located on the second floor, right next to the breakfast room, so we were woken up every morning a little before 7:00 by the staff that was getting the breakfast ready (could even hear them slicing bread). I would definately suggest you ask for a room that is either on the 1st floor or away from the breakfast room (our was 6B). Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was basic but nice (cake, two types of cereals, bread, cheese& ham, few fresh fruit, juice, milk, coffee) It cost me 45 euros from the airport by taxi to get to the hotel, but you can take the train to Termini station, and then the A line to Lepanto metro station (hotel is 5 minutes walk from there)

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: kay181
Reviews.Content: I stayed there a while ago so maybe thats why my review is different to the others! I absolutely loved this place! yes the room was small, but I dont need much room. It was tastefully decorated, the bathroom was nice and new. The hallways lined with scented candles (very nice touch) lovely breakfast area with meats, cheeses breads and cereals usual nice continental type. I think the website gives off the idea of a larger more spacious hotel. The reception when I went was tiny. But I didnt sleep in the reception so I didn't mind! It honestly had all the space you would need. Also, although it may not be in the thick of things, it was close to the vatican and anything else I wished to see was a pleasant walk away. Didn't use the metro once. I would definately recommend staying here and if you do there is a gorgeous little cafe called portofino about two minutes north of the hotel, i spent the end of every night in here munchin on canapes and drinking lovely well priced wine. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SusanBolton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 14 nights and it was a great hotel. The location is nice. It is a little bit quieter which after a long day of seeing the sites it is nice to escape the hsutle and bustle for a bit. We tended we walk to most places but did use the Metro for 4 days and with it being so close to a metro station it is perfect. On arrival at the hotel we actually went to another building for one night. This was not really an inconvience and they moved our luggage to the room we spent the next 13 nights while we were out. Breakfast was good and the staff that looked after you at breakfast and cleaned your rooms were friendly and kept the buffet stocked. If something did run out you just mentioned it and it was filled up again very quickly. Morning coffee was always the best one of the day. The roof garden was a relaxing place to go before going out for tea (Which is rather late if you don't have lunch after your big breakfast) and it was nice to have a game of pool (if you were not tired from being out all day) If I was to go back to Rome I would definately stay in this hotel again. They are having a little bit of work done downstairs (More rooms) and they are also building an outdoor area. However the work goes on during the day while you are out so this should not bother you. This hotel is definately a hidden Gem and is grat value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: caramacEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: We had such a lovely stay here and I am very surprised at previous reviews. I guess the work in the foyer is now finished as we saw no sign of a building site on our arrival. Our impression of the hotel was very clean, modern, welcoming and airy. Both owners take control and they are gorgeous. We stayed in one of the other buildings (round the corner) and a member of staff took our case and escorted us to the room, which was surprisingly lovely for the price. The free fresh fruit was also a nice touch. The location was great with lots of quality shops, cafes etc. on the door step. Also very close to major attractions and transport links, It is true there was some noise with that much happening around, but we wanted to be living in the middle of a big city so it's just part and parcel. Don't get me wrong, I am a huge sleepy-head in the morning and like nothing more than my sleep (except my daughters and best friends) but the noise of this new city gradually closing down then coming back to life, was quite soothing and established a sleep pattern. I will certainly stay here again. I will also make sure my friends know about it. Loved every minute of it.

Reviews.Title: “Rude owners even worse rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: spurs1986
Reviews.Content: On our arrival at Hotel Beldes, we walked into the reception (or building site as it were!) to be given a key and told we could take our own cases up and had to find our own room. We booked the hotle through the hotels direct website as it looked amazing, as you would expect we thought our room would look like one that was on the website. No such luck! The room we had been allocated was a discrace, tatty walls and furnishings, the bed felt crampted in such a small space. The reason for our trip was for my girlfriends birthday, i had booked the hotel for a unique and romantic trip away, upon arriving we were sorley disappointed. After seeing the room i went back to reception and asked if we could change rooms and asked why the room wasnt the same as those on the website. I spoke with a gentleman who i believe is one of the owners, i found him very rude and arrogant. I was informed that if i had wanted one of the better rooms i should of sent a request via email. I once again asked to change rooms but was informed that this was impossible due to being fully booked. It wasn't until i stated that i wished to cancel my booking and would not be staying in the hotel that he miraculously found another room, which he handed me the key to, and told me to go see if i thought that room was better. The second room was slightly better but still not to the standard we believed the hotels website portrayed. After both myself and my girlfriend went back to reception and argued with the owner we were shown a room in the dependence block away from the hotel. This room was gorgeous and everything we had expected it to be, unfortunately we had to stay one night in the main hotel in one of the rooms we had been previously been offered until dependence room was available. Once in this room the stay was lovley and the man who worked in the main hotels reception on an evening was wonderful, friendly and could'nt have been more helpful. The reduction we had been promised for moving rooms never happened upon departure, we decided it was too much hassle and just left it! Overall the hotel was well located and only 10 mins from main Rome centre, with some nice restaurants and bars in the area, Rome itself was amazing, shame the owners at Beldes do not have a clue about customer service and satisfaction!

Reviews.Title: “Never stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kliti
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we noticed that the hotel reception was a building site, but the hotel room was nice clean and comfortable. However we wre awoken around 8 a.m by drilling and banging from the builders, when we complained about the noise, nothing was done about it. This coupled with the fact that the majority of the staff were rude means that I would not recommend this hotel, I would advice to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eal7883
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Rome for our honeymoon, and we were very very pleased with this hotel. We arrived early, and the owners were nice enough to keep our bags for us while we did some sightseeing. Then they carried them over to our room when we checked in. We booked a "Dependency Room", in a building a couple blocks away from the main hotel. I've seen other people complain about this, but it really wasn't a far walk at all, and it felt like our own private apartment in Rome. The room was gorgeous, very clean, and I loved all the furnishings. It was very quiet at night, the only noise we heard was about 10 minutes/ night from the other honeymooners next door! I agree with other reviews that the walls are pretty thin. But all in all, this hotel was really great, and the location was excellent. Less than a 5 minute walk to the metro, and by cab it was only about 5-10 minutes to any part of Rome. The free internet worked flawlessly. We didn't really take advantage of the breakfast room, but it looked really nice. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip to Rome, it was the prettiest room I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome....Don't Stay at Beldes!!!”
Reviews.Author: KipperUk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our holiday at the Beldes HR in Rome. This trip was booked as a surprise for my partners 30th Birthday; I wanted to choose a unique boutique hotel instead of a multinational chain hotel to make it extra special and more romantic. I had seen the hotel on splendia.com and on the hotels official website and was impressed by the descriptions and photos. However, when we arrived we were told that we were staying in a separate building away from the hotel, which was two blocks away by foot. On arrival at this building it was in fact in a residential apartment building with no general facilities. Once inside the room, the decor and overall condition of the accommodation was good, the furnishings were stylish, however maybe a tad worn, but the bathroom was of a high standard and was clean and welcoming. I called the reception to clarify why I had been put into the separate building as on my initial booking I had paid a seperate amount and requested a non-annex room. The staff were very abrupt about this questioning and said that the rooms in the separate building were of a higher standard and much bigger. They seemed uninterested to answer my question of why there are two different prices for each building and insisted they were the same, they thought it was best we stay where we were. We decided to stay in the separate building and although we enjoyed our stay, the constant going back and forward for breakfast each morning, the use of Ironing facilities (which seemed to cause confusion and a lot of drama when asked about using an iron) and the use of the terrace was very annoying. If I had been travelling alone, I would not have been impressed staying in the separate building as we never saw any one else over there. You have to open 3 sets of main doors to access the rooms which would be quite daunting to some. Also the rooms do have a safe, however this is not attached to the wall and can be lifted and taken away very easily...some what pointless! I feel the photos displayed on the official website and on most promotional sites are very misleading as the rooms displayed are actually of the ones in the separate building and not of the main hotel. The main hotel rooms are plainly decorated and small in comparison. One major complaint would be the attitude and service of the staff who were rude and unwelcoming. Apart from the lady who served breakfast, the manager's and reception staff were abrupt and unapproachable, overall seemed very uninterested in customer satisfaction. On the whole I do feel that although the hotel has nice decor and good location for the sites of Rome it is let down by many basic fundamental facilities and attitude of staff. I also feel the website is very misleading and didn't portray the real Beldes, for this reason I would not recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly rude staff - never actually got to stay in the hotel proper!”
Reviews.Author: BluestockingGirl
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in this hotel for our 3 nt stay, we were told that we would be sent to another - much less luxurious - hotel about five minutes down the road as there was a problem with a leaking pipe in our room. Fair enough, we thought - these things happen. The following day when we returned to get our proper room, we weren't even put in the hotel, but in an unserviced room in a residential apartment another five mins away. It was on a very noisy street, and the air conditioning didn't work at first which is no joke in summer. When I asked for a small refund for the inconvenience caused, we were told by a very rude and indifferent member of staff that we wouldn't be given anything as we'd been foolish enough to pre-pay through Expedia. Clearly they had over-booked and selected us for poor treatment as we couldn't withhold payment. This is an increasingly ugly and sneaky tactic of careless hoteliers. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprise !!”
Reviews.Author: flurrywitten
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Beldes Guest House. The guest house was spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated. The choice of breakfast was very good, with everything ranging from cold meats, cheese, pastries, fruit juice through to Cake !! The only negative thing we both have to say is that the sound proofing is not very good in the rooms, we could hear everything that was going on in the rooms around us. The guesthouse is situated just a few minutes walk from the Vatican city and only 2 stops on the underground to the spanish steps and other of Rome's great sites. Overall we had a great time in Rome, and would recommend the Beldes to friends and family but warning them of the poor sound proofing.

Reviews.Title: “3-star or less”
Reviews.Author: sikiwong
Reviews.Content: Hotel Beldes was the worst hotel for our 2 weeks honeymoon. The staffs are ok friendly, but everything were wrongly arranged. Initally we made two separately reservations for two different dates, however, they did not cancel the 2nd reservation (as we planned to go to London instead) after we email notified them, and insisted to charged us for no-show fee!! Secondly, we requested a double room with bathtub for HONEYMOONERS, however, they provided a very noisy and dirty corner twin room for the first night, and the coffee machine in the breakfast room next door woke me up at 7am. On our second night they gave us another room, still no bathtub, but with 2 single bed joining to form a King bed and not as noisy. However, we discovered that a burberry coat was stolen in the room when they moved our stuffs from 1st room to the 2nd!!!!! They also showed us another building which they brought a flat and turned that into 3 suites, but we need to walk for 5-10 minutes under a cold weather to the main building breakfast room, so we refused to take that!

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Mel21
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the Lepanto metro station (line A) and we had no problem finding it although the entrance is small. We were greeted by a really friendly member of staff and were impressed by the communal corridors of the hotel as we made our way to our room.Our room 4b on the 2nd floor was however a little disappointing. It was clean and nicely decorated but very small and without a bath. We asked to change to a room with a bath and we're told they'd get back to us but never heard anything else about it and didn't see that member of staff again. We therefore decided to make do and not worry too much as the room was ok and clean. I wish however that we had moved as this room was very noisy. We could hear the toilet and the shower from next door but worse, we were right next to the breakfast room and were woken early every morning by plates, people and the TV. If you get put in 4B, move! I was also disappointed with the service. Again, nothing too terrible but i felt like no one made any special effort and it could have been so much better. Also whenever I went to the bar (which is the breakfast room) no body was there serving drinks even though it's meant to be open all day. I did like the breakfast and the breakfast room. If you're are looking for the pool table it's under the main table top! The roof garden looked lovely but too cold to be in use. It's in a resdiential area so away from the hustle and bustle but only a 10 minute walk to St peters Square and 10 minutes in the other direction to Piazza del Popolo. Make use of the Metro as it's only 1euro and so close. There are a few local resturants very close to the hotel - we ate in these are were impressed with the food and the price - plus it wasn't far to walk home! So - location fine if you don't mind not being in the centre of things, area safe, decor nice, hotel average, room 4b clean but small and too noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NovemberTravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Beldes for six nights in November and when we return to Rome, we will most definitely stay again! The hotel is located in a VERY safe, friendly section of Rome. We walked around at 10 -11 pm without any fear or complication. The Metro (A line) is two short blocks away, Lepanto stop. It took us two minutes to walk to it. Better yet, most sights are within walking distance! (If you do stay for more than a couple of days, buy the 7 day pass, you can hop on and off Roman buses and trains without limit.) The hotel is tastefully decorated in French Provincial styling. (While refreshing in its own right, it's extremely welcoming after a day of sight-seeing the opulence of Rome.) I was tickled to see the attention to detail in the accouterments, including the whimsical and revolving artwork. One feels like they are staying at the house of a hip, young Roman, versus a stuffy, mass produced hotel. The room was very clean, with hard wood floors. The bed was comfortable and an extra pillow can be found on the top shelf of the armoire. Each room is equipped with a thermostat to control the temperature, a refrigerator (with mini-bar), safe, and hair-dryer. The rooms are average-sized in European standards. The bathrooms are spotless. The towels are thick and of excellent quality. (Italian hotels do not typically provide washcloths, so if you don't feel complete without them, pack a few of your own.) A glass-encased shower (which enables you to avoid the icky-hotel-shower-curtain-cling) with excellent water-pressure and bidet complete the bathroom. The Breakfast Room on the top floor is sunny and cheerful, stocked with good-quality linens and pastel-colored Italian china. The complimentary breakfast (served buffet style) includes: cold-cuts, cheese, rolls & croissants, fresh fruit, yogurt, several cereals, and a variety of delicious pastries. Say hello to Suzanna, who will bring coffee and tea to your table. After reading TA reviews, I was concerned about being "relegated" to the annex and emailed them requesting to stay in the main building. I spoke to a 50-something couple from Canada and a 20-something couple from France who both told us that they actually PREFERRED it. They both told me it was similarly decorated and maintained. Furthermore, the rooms appeared to be LARGER and QUIETER. So either way, don't fret, your stay at the Beldes will be enjoyable! Because of the wooden floors, sound does travel. But I'd prefer wooden floors -- which can be mopped and cleaned easily - over rugs - which trap vasts amount of bacteria and dirt - any day! If you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs. I am a very particular individual and whole-heartedly recommend the Beldes. Research, research, research, but once you hit Rome, throw caution to the wind and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: ILBahamas
Reviews.Content: This little boutique hotel is charming. The rooms are beautifully decorated and very modern and clean. The complimentary breakfast is delightful and complimentary wine on the rooftop (overlooking St. Peter's) in the evening is very special. The staff is very knowledgable and most helpful. We walked easily to everywhere in Rome, the Metro stop is just at the corner if you wish to ride. I would recommend this charmer to all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reviews4u
Reviews.Content: I felt that I should add my review on this hotel after reading the previous traveller reviews, so here goes.... The hotel is situated just a few moments away from Lepanto metro station, so we found the hotel easily from Ciampino airport. (just take the bus from Ciampino airport to Termini rail station & jump on the metro line A and get off at Lepanto). As mentioned in a previous review the hotel plaque is very small, so it would be quite easy to miss the entrance unless you had the full address. On arrival we were welcomed & taken to our room, we were in room 6A, which was a good size pretty room with a "French Boutique" feel to it. The room probably could have done with a lick of paint, and the hot & cold taps on the shower/taps were round the wrong way!! but other than that it was fine, especially for the price we paid. The breakfast room is upstairs and is served until 10am, it was a continental breakfast, including rolls, cheese, meats, croissants, cereals, yougarts, fruit and some AMAZING cakes mmmm, we really filled up on breakfast and rarely felt hungry again before the afternoon. The rooftop terrace is a really nice place for chilling out, we did not really use it, but I can imagine in the Summer its a great place to spend the evening with a few drinks. The small reception area always seemed to be manned, and the staff were so friendly & helpful, they gave us maps, directions, resturant reccomendations & information whenever we needed it. This is not a 5* hotel, its a pretty informal guest house in an excellant location, so if thats what you are looking for then its perfect. Overall I thought the hotel was really good value, and I would have no problem reccomending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel to stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: ninaisrael
Reviews.Content: we had 9 nights at the beldes hotel for our hoenymoon..as we arrived they told us we were upgraded to a room with a jacozy, but not in the same bulding. the room was in an apartment complex 2 blooks away,it was small but absolotly beutyfull, clean and we loved it! there was a coffie-kit in the room and an espresso mashin in the hallway, as well as umbrelas you could use if it was a rainy day . we had a key to the bulding as well so we could come and go as we pleased, and had our breakfast in the main bulding. the breakfast is fine, and the realy great thing about this hotel is the location- we like to walk and did not use metro or cabs even once in 9 days! the erea feels very safe at night, has a lot of shops, and there are nice non-turistic restorants near by. it's a few minutes walk from piaza de popolo, and about 20 min' from the center-piaza navona. rome is wonderfull and we were very happy with this hotel. a very important thing is we asked in advance not to be close to the breakfast room after reading soom reviews about the noise, and when we were there we could imagin they were right to recomend it becouse it opens very early...

Reviews.Title: “An Island of Peace in the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: TravelInStyleZurich
Reviews.Content: Staying at Hotel Beldes is like coming home - it's one of the finest Boutique Hotels in Rome. Why? Because they do things differently, and in a very own, modern way. Our room looked and felt like a cosy guest room in a comfortable private home. The tastefully matching colours as well as the choice of elegant textiles and cool furniture made me want to re-decorate our bedroom back home, and presto. Breakfast is served in a lovely living room which transforms into a pool billard hall in the evenings. And if you want to get a tan while in Rome you chill out in the spacious roof garden. The location is very central, yet rather quiet, in the upmarket residential area of Prati, close to, and east of the Vatican. The nearest Metro Station is just one block away. All in all, the Beldes is the place we would choose again: Great, stylish accommodation at a fair price and very charming hosts with a passionate devotion to making you feel comfortable - and make the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Dont book to stay here”
Reviews.Author: laura_200810
Reviews.Content: Booked two nights at the Beldes in October and on arrival we were told there was no room available and we would have to stay at another hotel a few blocks away. They moved us to the vatican gardens hotel which was about a 10 minute walk from the Beldes and we ended up staying there for one night. We then had to pack our cases in the morning and move to the Beldes for the second night. The staff at the Beldes are unhelpful and the rooms need improvement. Breakfast is also limited. Definately better hotels in Rome to stay..

Reviews.Title: “Be careful as you might not be staying in the hotel at all!”
Reviews.Author: sharontrayers
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel to be greeted by a friendly young man, he told us that we had been "upgraded" to the presidential suite. Of course we were delighted, however he proceeded to walk us outside the building. We were marched to a building two blocks away to an apartment complex. We were shown to a small neat spotless room but I have to say that we were worried about the whole security aspect of the hotel. When I asked if it was possible to move to the hotel I was told that it was booked out and that there was no possible chance of us staying there. This was very disappointing. I think that the hotel owner was shocked that we would even consider wanting to move as we had been "upgraded" to this room. The safe in the room was not built in so someone could just walk out with it under their arm. The breakfasts were adequate but all the delph was chipped. The hotel staff were very friendly though and we did really enjoy our experience in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel as good as Rome has to offer”
Reviews.Author: Glasson1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in this hotel. Before i go any further, let me explain about hotels in Rome. They are generally smaller and things such as air conditioning, safe, en-suite even a hairdryer etc are seen as extras (from what i saw talking to others). The room we had at the Beldes had all these and was very reasonably priced. The location was pretty good 100m from the nearest metro. The city is very easy to get around and the hotel location means you can get a nights sleep easily and still be in the hub of the city in minutes. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast set us up nicely for the day. It was a lovely family run quirky hotel. Would definitely stay here again if in Rome. Rome is a really cool city and not expensive or in any way dangerous. We really enjoyed our stay. Old buildings dominate and there are very few of the skyscrapers you see in other major cities. It has really developed while still holding on to its past.

Reviews.Title: “You may be staying in another building a few streets away”
Reviews.Author: ptdublin
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to check in to the hotel beldes, we were told by the receptionist to come with him. He locked the door and we followed him for a 5 minute walk down the road to an apartment block. There appeared to be approximately 7 rooms of the hotel beldes on the 4th floor of this building. Although the room in the apartment block was nicely decorated and comfortable, we were not expecting this. It also was somewhat incovenient to go for breakfast in the mornings. I would advise people to check with the hotel prior to their arrival that they will be staying the main building and not the apartment block.

Reviews.Title: “I have reported this hotel for Fraudulent Credit Card Activity”
Reviews.Author: leihoma
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at this hotel, I thought we had hit gold, until it was time to check out. The hotel charged my card twice, I was not aware until I had returned home and saw it on my statement. I contacted the hotel, they said they couldnt prove it, so I had to send them my statement (why they could not look on their very own bank statements I dont know). I am still waiting for a response, and have now had to report this hotel to my credit card company who is investigating the hotel for fraudulent activity. My advice.......pay in cash or beware.....

Reviews.Title: “English stay down the road!”
Reviews.Author: poppygrant
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 days in Rome staying at the Beldes hotel., convenient location and quiet road. Staff very nice and hotel very clean with lovely rooms. However, we were put in an appartment down the road which was very nice but inconvenient as had to come to hotel for breakfast and for the roof garden (now complete). It did seem to be all of the english guests staying down the road so beware! Breakfast adequate although dining room is not very spacious or comfortable. No complementary taxi service to the airport was offerred apart from ordering a taxi we had to pay for. We left our luggage there on the last day but it was just put in the basement and a camera was stolen from the bag. Advice- don't leave luggage there unless it is securely locked. Generally was a good place to stay but hotel is about to extend as they have bought the hotel next door.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: newlywedSheffield
Reviews.Content: My partner and I visited this delightful hotel for our honeymoon in August. The sign outside is very small to spot from the street. It is situated very close to Lepanto metro stop.The rooms were spotless and well presented. We were pleased to have air conditioning and a power shower to cool us down. The breakfast on offer was excellent, with a choice of cereals, bread, cheese, ham, fruit or cake selection. The staff were very friendly and the hotel felt very secure with someone on the door at all times. There is also a small safe deposit box in your room. Hotel Beldes is situated in a very good spot for visiting all the main sites. It is approximately 15 minutes walk to the Vatican and about 20mins stroll to Piazza Navona. We will definately be visiting again in the future and have recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely divine”
Reviews.Author: emmanuelle29
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful, stylish rooms, very clean, great service, staff very helpful, excellent breakfast, lovely roof garden, worth every penny and more.

Reviews.Title: “loved the bedroom”
Reviews.Author: catherine2Ireland
Reviews.Content: The Beldes HR Hotel in Rome was an excellent hotel,the staff were very friendly and helpfull.The bedroom was very spacious and the decor was lovely. The breakfast was also lovely with fresh croisants bread ham and cheese it also offered fresh cakes and fruit juice and cereals. I Would recomend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome. It is in close proximity to the Metro for travelling to various parts of the city and about ten minutes walk from the vatician. The only slight complaint is that the hotel is not very well sign posted with only a plague outside the hotel with the name on it, wich could easily be missed. we thourghly enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would definetely stay there if visting Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!!”
Reviews.Author: Hydee13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Beldes for 5 nights. It is a wonderful boutique hotel one block from the Lepanto Metro stop. The building and rooms are amazing. Our room was beautiful, a good size, very comfortable bed, excellent bathroom and shower. Breakfast was nice, a selection of cakes, salami, cheese, yogurt, cereal etc. The cappuccino was very good. The rooftop patio is wonderful, excellent views and comfortable furniture, there is a bar service until 8pm. My only complaint is that the walls are rather thin and you can hear noise, especially if you have someone inconsiderate next to you. However, we only had one night that we really noticed it, the others were very quiet. The noisy neighbors must have checked out!! The location is excellent, away from the noise of the major sites but close to great restaurants and shopping!! Within walking distance to the Vatican, many of the other sites are walkable but the Metro system in Rome is excellent and very cheap and convenient. I recommend you walk down towards the Castel Sant' Angelo and cross the beautiful bridge in front of it and head towards the Piazza Navona. There are many sites nearby to visit, it's a great walk. You must have pizza from Pizza Colonna, take out place next to Lepanto stop and San Marco restaurant is a short walk, excellent meal. We would absolutely return to Hotel Beldes, we loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: watchd0g
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Beldes for 4 nights together with my adult son. The hotel is not easy to find; only a small sign next to the entrance. Reception is only a small desk next to the entrance doors, stairs and lift. Our room was just big enough, but lovely decorated and very clean, and with no carpets for which I was very grateful. It also had airconditioning which is needed at this time of the year in Rome. We also loved our daily breakfast buffet and lounging on the rooftop terrace during the hot midday hours. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Room rates are quite reasonable. The hotel is in a central but quiet location. 5 minutes walk to the Metro and 15 minutes walk to St Peter. The hotel has no pool and no restaurant, but we easily found a variety of restaurant nearby. I would happily recommend the Beldes hotel to anyone who is looking for a comfortable stay, but does not want to spend a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PinkUnicorn
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Beldes in Rome was very nice and exceeded my expectations! The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was modern and tastefully decorated and the area was quiet and peaceful. The bathroom was fantastic by European standards with a larger, brand new shower. I have no complaints about this hotel and will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkcira
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean hotel. Has a stand-up shower in bathroom and a flat screen TV in bedroom. On a side street near Vatican. Easy walk across river to all other attractions in Rome. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: 2Taylor
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my Birthday with my Boyfriend from the 22nd -26th March 2008 and has a fantastic time. The Hotel is great, very clean and tidy and the smelt of chocolate ;-). It is in a fantastic location, easy walking distance to the metro stop and Vatican City. The staff were lovely and very helpful and I will for sure be recommending this hotel to other people, also when I am next in Rome I will be staying here again too. A great Hotel I can not say a bad thing about it, keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Guest House”
Reviews.Author: Monk007
Reviews.Content: With well decorated and stylish rooms my fiancée and I loved our stay here. All the staff, including the owners, made our 5 night stay really special. The Guest House Beldes is a fantastic little boutique guest house close to the Metro Lepanto and approximately a ten minute walk to the Vatican. The hotels location made it really easy to get around Rome (either by walking or metro) whilst still being in an area with good local shops and plenty of restaurants. I would happily recommend this guest house to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, People and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JayGreco
Reviews.Content: The Guest House Beldes is a fantastic little boutique hotel in a cool little nieghbourhood close to the Metro Lepanto and the Vatican. Brand new with really stylish rooms me and my girlfreind loved our stay here and the guys at reception, who were also the owners, really made our it reallly special. The breakfast was really good which is usually one of the dissadvantages of the smaller places and where it is was made it really easy to get around and enjoy the sites and attractions that seem to be everywhere. Would advise this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelsister07
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights and had a wonderful stay in large twin room which was tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean. This boutique hotel is in a great location for both metro and bus line and walking distance to many attractions. The morning breakfast was excellent and the service friendly and efficient. John Paolo, one of the owners, was on site each day and very pleasant and helpful. The combination dining room/living room had the feel of being in a home. We enjoyed the many small attentions to detail of the decor and the feeling of being home. Thank you staff and owners of Beldes for making our stay wonderful, and we highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not like the website”
Reviews.Author: Middo333
Reviews.Content: If you are booking your stay at this hotel based on the website, prepare yourself for a little disappointment. Most parts are true, the staff are very friendly and helpful and the place is pretty much spotless, however, there are some inconsistencies. I was enticed by the description of 'stylish bar with pool table', 'roof top garden' and 'experienced cocktail barman'; there is no bar, just a breakfast room which is completely unmanned except for when breakfast is served, and there is no pool table. I walked up the stairs to the top floor to try a cocktail on the roof top garden only to find a completely empty space, except for a pile of building materials. I know the place has recently opened but I would expect them to hold back on the advertising until it's actually finished. It's also pretty hard to spot from outside as the entrance boasts the name of the hotel next door - when you look through the entrance, there are two doors, their's has an A4 piece of paper stuck on it that says 'Beldes HR' . Other than the false advertising, it was a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ikey626
Reviews.Content: nicest little boutique hotel we've stayed in in Italy! Rooms are small but very tastefully decorated and spotless.The owners Simone & John Paolo were wonderful and very helpful! Breakfast was included & very good& the breakfast room was cool. The staff always had a smile & a greeting. Location was great, walking distance to all and good restaurants in the area. Would definetly recommend and will go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A Clean, Friendly & Modern Base Camp”
Reviews.Author: Tooshy
Reviews.Content: A 10 minute walk from the Vatican Museum and Basilica, this neat little hotel only had about 10 rooms but ours was V Clean, V Neat and excellent for us as we only needed a base camp for our tours of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like at home”
Reviews.Author: JmwAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Wonderful new boutique hotel, managed with professionalism and politiness. Rooms are brand new, extremely well cleaned; the stuff is friendly and very helpful. The breakfast room is excellent. A big table gives you the opportunity to seat with other guests and share information and experience in Rome. Not to mention the proximity of the metro station and the Vatican City (you can walk there!!) I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!!
